alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; Annette Island; Cape Fairweather to Lisianski Strait; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Sitka; City and Borough of Wrangell; City and Borough of Yakutat; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 1:06PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG STORM EXPECTED SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A storm force front is expected to move into the area from the SW on Saturday spreading gusty winds and heavy precipitation across the region. Most of the precipitation is expected to fall as rain with the highest rain rates expected Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. Total rainfall of around 1 to 3 inches is expected across the region through Sunday. Some areas in the north still have some snow on the ground which could add additional runoff as it melts. No flooding is expected at this time, though area rivers could show rises. In addition gusty winds are expected around the same time. Highest winds will be felt around the Southern Panhandle and Outer Coast. See the high wind watch for more details. Other areas will likely see gusts ranging in the 40 to 55 mph range Saturday afternoon into Saturday night. Brief break in the weather is expected on Sunday afternoon into Sunday night before another strong storm is looking likely to come up from the south on Monday. Expect another round of rain and wind especially for the southern panhandle Monday into Monday night. Stay tuned to the National Weather Service for updates at weather.gov/Juneau.
